[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/components/framework.rs] [Function: generate_upgrade_proposals()] [File permission vulnerability] Are temporary files created with secure permissions (0600), or can other users read/modify proposal scripts during generation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/components/framework.rs] [Function: generate_upgrade_proposals()] [Comment injection] Can an attacker manipulate commit_info to inject malicious Move code comments that appear legitimate but contain backdoors? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/components/framework.rs] [Function: generate_upgrade_proposals()] [Git hash spoofing] Can aptos_build_info::get_git_hash() be spoofed to hide the true source of malicious framework code? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/components/framework.rs] [Function: generate_upgrade_proposals()] [Script concatenation vulnerability] Can string concatenation in format!() and push_str() be exploited to inject malicious Move code or comments into scripts? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/components/framework.rs] [Function: generate_upgrade_proposals()] [Unicode injection] Can attacker use Unicode characters in commit_info or script_name to create visually deceptive proposals that hide malicious code? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/components/framework.rs] [Function: generate_upgrade_proposals()] [Builder commit mismatch] Can the 'Builder commit hash' comment differ from the actual builder version, allowing outdated/vulnerable builders to generate proposals? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/components/framework.rs] [Function: generate_upgrade_proposals()] [Package ordering attack] Can reversing package_path_list for multi-step proposals cause dependency resolution issues or execution order vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/components/framework.rs] [Function: generate_upgrade_proposals()] [Package skipping] Is there validation that all packages in package_path_list are processed, or can some be silently skipped causing incomplete upgrades? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/components/framework.rs] [Function: generate_upgrade_proposals()] [Duplicate package] Can an attacker add duplicate entries to package_path_list causing the same package to be upgraded twice with different versions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/components/framework.rs] [Function: generate_upgrade_proposals()] [Missing package] What happens if a critical package like '0x1' aptos-framework is missing from package_path_list - can this create an incomplete/vulnerable upgrade? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/components/framework.rs] [Function: generate_upgrade_proposals()] [Package interdependency] Are package dependencies properly resolved, or can circular dependencies or missing dependencies cause compilation failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/components/framework.rs] [Function: generate_upgrade_proposals()] [Hardcoded package list] Can the hardcoded package_path_list be modified to add malicious packages or remove security-critical packages? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/components/framework.rs] [Function: generate_upgrade_proposals()] [Unwrap panic] Can unwrap() calls on file_name(), to_str(), and to_string() be triggered by malformed paths causing panics that abort proposal generation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/components/framework.rs] [Function: generate_upgrade_proposals()] [Error propagation bypass] Can Result<?> errors from BuiltPackage::build() or ReleasePackage::new() be swallowed or mishandled, causing corrupt proposals to be generated? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/components/framework.rs] [Function: generate_upgrade_proposals()] [Partial failure handling] If one package fails to compile, is the entire proposal generation aborted, or can partial/inconsistent proposals be generated? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/components/framework.rs] [Function: generate_upgrade_proposals()] [Git operation failures] Are git2::Repository errors properly handled, or can network failures or authentication issues cause undefined behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/components/framework.rs] [Function: generate_upgrade_proposals()] [Exception safety] If an exception occurs mid-generation, are temporary files cleaned up and is the system left in a consistent state? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/components/framework.rs] [Function: generate_upgrade_proposals()] [Config validation] Is FrameworkReleaseConfig properly validated before use, or can malicious configs with extreme values cause undefined behavior? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/components/framework.rs] [Function: generate_upgrade_proposals()] [Git hash format] Is git_hash validated for proper SHA-1/SHA-256 format, or can arbitrary strings cause git operation failures or injection attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/components/framework.rs] [Function: generate_upgrade_proposals()] [Boolean flag confusion] Can is_testnet and is_multi_step flags be set to conflicting states that bypass security checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/components/framework.rs] [Function: generate_upgrade_proposals()] [Next hash validation] Is next_execution_hash properly validated before being passed to multi-step proposal generation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/components/framework.rs] [Function: generate_upgrade_proposals()] [Empty string handling] Can empty strings in git_hash, publish_addr, or package paths cause crashes or unexpected behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/components/framework.rs] [Function: generate_upgrade_proposals()] [Memory exhaustion] Can large compiled packages or excessive temporary files cause memory exhaustion during proposal generation? (Medium)
